territory.short-form-name: United Provinces of the Rio de la Plata
territory.notes: From 1810 to 1816, the Viceroyalty of the Rio de la Plata, renamed the United Provinces of the Rio de la Plata, was governed from Buenos Aires by a local, autonomous government ostensibly loyal to the deposed Spanish king Ferdinand VII. In 1810, the cabildo (town council) of Buenos Aires exiled the viceroy and set up an autonomous government. In 1816, an assembly declared the United Provinces of the Rio de la Plata independent from Spain. Between 1816 and 1861, the United Provinces suffered from a series of civil wars between centralists (called Unitarians) and federalists, over how much power should be centralized in Buenos Aires.
